title: James Corden hops off to the big city and skydives in first trailer for Peter Rabbit 2: The Runaway
text:
James Corden's lovable rogue hops away from his beloved garden to have daredevil adventures in the big city in the first trailer for Sony Pictures' Peter Rabbit 2: The Runaway.

In Will Gluck's live-action/CG comedy sequel, Thomas McGregor (Domhnall Gleeson) and his new wife Bea (Rose Byrne) leave their farm and critters to embark on her book tour.

Feeling disillusioned by his newfound fame and mischievous reputation at home, Peter (Corden) decides he's 'better off without them' and runs away.

Solo: James Corden's lovable rogue hops away from his beloved garden to have daredevil adventures in the big city in the first trailer for Sony Pictures' Peter Rabbit 2: The Runaway

Newlyweds: In Will Gluck's live-action/CG sequel, Thomas McGregor (Domhnall Gleeson) and his new wife Bea (Rose Byrne) leave their farm and critters to embark on her book tour

Encouraging Peter's 'baddy, baddy' side is his new fruit-stealing rabbit pal Barnabus, who used to be friends with his 'fierce, bad' father.

There's shots of Peter jumping on a train for a free ride like a hobo as well as jumping off a boat alongside a brown jacket-clad pal.

Peter is clearly not the only rabbit in on the action as his whole family comes looking for him as he discovers the type of rabbit he ultimately wants to be.

The climax of the preview revealed Peter, Flopsy (Margot Robbie), Mopsy (Elizabeth Debicki), and another man skydiving out of a small plane.

Peter Rabbit 2: The Runaway - based on Beatrix Potter's 1902 children's book - will be released in US theaters April 3 and in UK theaters March 27.

Last year's Peter Rabbit was a massive hit - amassing $351.2M at the global box office from a $50M budget despite mixed reviews (63% on Rotten Tomatoes).
